intro: Androcymbium orienticapense, commonly known as the oriental cup-plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive cup-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant is native to parts of East Asia, including China and Korea, and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. The species is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
